newsitem.title: USA: Computervision holders back BOD nominees.
newsitem.headline: Computervision holders back BOD nominees.

text.p: Computervision Corp on Wednesday said that two large shareholders have delivered to the company proxies in favor of the election of all nominees for directors at the company's annual meeting June 10, 1997.
Computervision said the two shareholders own a total of about 21 percent of the company's outstanding common stock.
"This is purely routine," said company spokeswoman Mindy Kohl.
Kohl said the shareholders are supporting two nominees for directors who are replacing two directors who've stepped down, John Cunningham and Lawrence Landry.
The company said that Sanjiv Ahuja, president and chief operating officer of software firm Bellcore, and Henry Ancona, an executive at Polaroid Corp, have been nominated to the Computervision board.
